# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/linux-arm64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_internal/commands/__init__.py
@source-hash: e6844ef4eddd336b
@generated: 2026-02-09T18:00:10Z

## Purpose
Command registry and factory for pip's internal command system. Serves as the central registry mapping command names to their implementation modules and provides dynamic command instantiation.

## Key Components

**CommandInfo namedtuple (L11)**
- Data structure holding `(module_path, class_name, summary)` for each command
- Enables lazy loading and help text generation without importing command modules

**commands_dict (L20-106)**
- Central registry mapping command names to CommandInfo instances
- Contains all 17 pip commands: install, download, uninstall, freeze, inspect, list, show, check, config, search, cache, index, wheel, hash, completion, debug, help
- Order matters for help display output
- Full module paths used to facilitate testing

**create_command() (L109-118)**
- Factory function for dynamic command instantiation
- Takes command name and optional kwargs
- Uses importlib to dynamically import command module
- Returns configured Command instance with name, summary, and additional kwargs

**get_similar_commands() (L121-132)**
- Auto-correction helper using difflib.get_close_matches()
- Returns closest matching command name for typos/misspellings
- Case-insensitive matching against commands_dict keys

## Dependencies
- `importlib`: Dynamic module loading for command classes
- `collections.namedtuple`: CommandInfo structure
- `difflib`: Fuzzy string matching for command suggestions
- `pip._internal.cli.base_command.Command`: Base class for all commands

## Architectural Patterns
- Registry pattern: Central command mapping avoids costly imports during help display
- Factory pattern: create_command() provides uniform command instantiation
- Lazy loading: Commands only imported when actually needed
- Separation of concerns: Command metadata separate from implementation
